ovdesc.p: This table contains company level default values which will be used when processing POSITION.TRANSFER and SECURITY.TRANSFER transactions.
These defaults will be applicable irrespective of the transaction type. The user must create one record for each company on the system.

desc.p: The default charges on a POSITION.TRANSFER or SECURITY.TRANSFER in local currency.
The default charges amount expressed in local currency on input of a SECURITY.TRANSFER or POSITION.TRANSFER.
0 - 15 Numeric characters. (Optional Input)
The default TRANSACTION code for all "Credit" CU.COMMISSION transactions.
To facilitate the matching of the TRANSACTION code number to the application to which it refers, ranges have been assigned to each application.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
(Mandatory Input if "CU.COMMISSION" entered else Optional)
Must exist as a valid TRANSACTION code.
The default TRANSACTION code for all "debit" CU.COMMISSION transactions.
To facilitate the matching of the TRANSACTION code number to the application to which it refers, ranges have been assigned to each application.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
(Mandatory Input if "CU.COMMISSION" entered else Optional)
Must exist as a valid TRANSACTION code.
For a POSITION.TRANSFER transaction the system must have a default to a delivery instruction type as contained within the SC.DEL.INSTR table as it is not an input within the transaction itself.
As there are no delivery instructions contained within the POSITION.TRANSFER application this field must contain the exact user requirement.
Examples: For a normal POSITION.TRANSFER there would be no inherent delivery to be made externally and the delivery instructions would reflect this fact with a no delivery, no payment flag set.
1-5 Alphanumeric characters. Standard delivery instruction. (Mandatory Input)
Must exist on the SC.DEL.INSTR table.
The default TRANSACTION code for all "Debit" local tax transactions.
To facilitate the matching of the TRANSACTION code number to the application to which it refers, ranges have been assigned to each application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 - Securities
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.

This field defines the type of delivery advise for deliveries (transfers out with collection advise) that will be generated by the SECURITY.TRANSFER applications based on the value in the "TRANSACTION.TYPE" field.

When the user enters a value in the "TRANSACTION.TYPE" field of the SECURITY.TRANSFER application that equals the value in this field the system will generate a delivery advise based on the DE.MAPPING keys 510.SC.0042 (Receipt advise for sign off at the counter) and 510.SC.0043 (Collection advise for sending to the customer).
1 - 5 Alphanumeric characters. (Mandatory Input)
Must exist on the SC.TRANS.NAME table.
The default TRANSACTION code for all "Credit" CU.TAX transactions.
To facilitate the matching of the TRANSACTION code number to the application to which it refers, ranges have been assigned to each application.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
(Mandatory Input if "CU.TAX" entered else Optional)
Must exist as a valid TRANSACTION code.

YES/NO flag controlling whether the POSITION.TRANSFER application allows the transfer of short positions. If this field is set to YES then then the transfer of short positions is allowed. If this field is set to NO or left blank then the transfer of short positions will not be allowed.
Only input of YES or No will be allowed.
Optional field though if this field is left blank POSITION.TRANSFER will behave as if it were set to NO.
The default TRANSACTION code for all "debit" CU.TAX transactions.
To facilitate the matching of the TRANSACTION code number to the application to which it refers, ranges have been assigned to each application.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
(Mandatory Input if "CU.TAX" entered else Optional)
Must exist as a valid TRANSACTION code.
This field defines the type of delivery advise for deliveries (to the depository) that will be generated by the SECURITY.TRANSFER applications based on the value in the "TRANSACTION.TYPE" field.

When the user enters a value in the "TRANSACTION.TYPE" field of the SECURITY.TRANSFER application that equals the value in this field the system will generate a delivery advise based on the DE.MAPPING keys 510.SC.0043 (Delivery confirmation to the customer) and if the "BROKER.NO" is not a bank broker and defined in the "BANK.BROKER.NO" of the SC.PARAMETER table an advise based on 510.SC.0044 (Delivery advise to the broker).
1 - 5 Alphanumeric characters (Mandatory Input)
Must exist on the SC.TRANS.NAME table.

This field defines the type of delivery advise for deliveries (transfers out with sending advise) that will be generated by the SECURITY.TRANSFER application based on the value in the "TRANSACTION.TYPE" field.

When the user enters a value in the "TRANSACTION.TYPE" field of the SECURITY.TRANSFER application that equals the value in this field the system will generate a delivery advise based on the DE.MAPPING keys 510.SC.0044 (Sending advise to the customer) and 510.SC.0045 (Receipt confirmation to the customer or broker) and, if the broker is not a "BANK.BROKER.NO" as defined on the SC.PARAMETER file a 510.SC.0046 (Delivery confirmation to the customer).
1 - 5 Alphanumeric characters. (Mandatory Input)
Must exist on the SC.TRANS.NAME table.
A valid security transaction type which has been set up in the SC.TRANS.TYPE tables for "Debit" transactions. The System will utilise this default value when a POSITION.TRANSFER is entered.
1-3 Alphanumeric characters. Standard securities transaction name. (Mandatory Input)
Must exist on the SC.TRANS.NAME table.
The default TRANSACTION code for all security "Credit" transactions where foreign exchange profit & loss may occur.
To facilitate the matching of the TRANSACTION code number to the application to which it refers, ranges have been assigned to each application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.(Mandatory Input)
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
Must exist as a valid TRANSACTION code.

A valid security transaction type which has been set up in the SC.TRANS.NAME and SC.TRANS.TYPE tables for "Credit" transactions. As this is not input at transaction level within the SECURITY.TRANSFER the system must default to this transaction code.
1-3 Alphanumeric characters. Standard securities transaction name. (Mandatory Input)
Must exist on the SC.TRANS.NAME table.
This field defines the percentage of local tax that will be levied on the net value of a SECURITY.TRANSFER.

This field is used to calculate the default value of the "LOCAL.TAX" field in the SECURITY.TRANSFER application. If the user does not enter the value in the "LOCAL.TAX" field, then the system will apply this rate to the net value ("GROSS.AMT.SEC.CCY" less "CHARGES") to calculate the local tax owing.
0 - 11 Alphanumeric characters (Optional Input)
Must be a positive real number greater than zero.
This field defines the type of delivery advise for deliveries (TRANSFERS OUT) that will be generated by the SECURITY.TRANSFER applications based on the value in the "TRANSACTION.TYPE" field.

When the user enters a value in the "TRANSACTION.TYPE" field of the SECURITY.TRANSFER application that equals the value in this field the system will generate a delivery advise based on the DE.MAPPING key 510.SC.0042 (Internal receipt advise).
1 - 5 Alphanumeric characters. (Mandatory Input)
Must exist on the SC.TRANS.NAME table.
The default debit transaction code for all foreign exchange profit & loss related entries within the POSITION.TRANSFER or SECURITY.TRANSFER applications.
To facilitate the matching of the TRANSACTION code number to the application to which it refers, ranges have been assigned to each application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.(Mandatory Input)
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
Must exist as a valid TRANSACTION code.
Specifies the internal account CATEGORY code for the "CU.TAX" amount entered in the SECURITY.TRANSFER application.
Each business transaction within T24 is allocated a CATEGORY code which enables reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the banks operations.
5 Numeric characters. (Mandatory Input if "CU.TAX" entered else Optional)
Must be in the range of 10000 to 19999
Must be a valid CATEGORY code.
This field defines the type of delivery advise for deposits (with confirmation advise) that will be generated by the SECURITY.TRANSFER applications based on the value in the "TRANSACTION.TYPE" field.

When the user enters a value in the "TRANSACTION.TYPE" field of the SECURITY.TRANSFER application that equals the value in this field, the system will generate a delivery advise based on the DE.MAPPING key 510.SC.0041 (Receipt advise for customer), and if the "DEPOSITORY" field does not equal any of the depositories as entered in the "BANK.DEPO.NO's" in the SC.PARAMETER table the system will generate delivery advises based on DE.MAPPING records 510.SC.0047 (Sending advise to the depository) and 510.SC.0048 (Receipt confirmation to the depository).
1 - 5 Alphanumeric characters. (Mandatory Input)
Must exist on the SC.TRANS.NAME table.
The default TRANSACTION code for all "Credit" local tax transactions.
To facilitate the matching of the TRANSACTION code number to the application to which it refers, ranges have been assigned to each application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600-649 = Securities
1 - 3 Numeric characters. (Mandatory Input if "LOCAL.TAX.RATE" entered else Optional)
Must exist as a valid TRANSACTION code.
This field defines the type of delivery advise for deposits (TRANSFERS IN) that will be generated by the ECURITY.TRANSFER applications based on the value in the "TRANSACTION.TYPE" field.

When the user enters a value in the "TRANSACTION.TYPE" field of the SECURITY.TRANSFER application that equals the value in this field the system will generate a delivery advise based on the DE.MAPPING key 510.SC.0041 (Receipt advise for customer).
1 - 5 Alphanumeric characters. (Mandatory Input)
Must exist on the SC.TRANS.NAME table.
Specifies the profit and loss CATEGORY code for the "LOCAL.TAX" amount calculated or entered in the SECURITY.TRANSFER application.

This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction within T24 is allocated a CATEGORY code which enables reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the banks operations.
4 or 5 Numeric characters. (Mandatory Input if "LOCAL.TAX.RATE" entered else Optional)
Must be in the range of 14000 to 14999.
Must be a valid CATEGORY code.
Specifies the profit & loss CATEGORY code for all foreign exchange profit & loss calculated within the POSITION.TRANSFER or SECURITY.TRANSFER applications.

This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction within T24 is allocated a CATEGORY code which enables reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operations.
4 or 5 Numeric characters. a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. (Mandatory Input)
Must be in the range 50000 to 59999.
Must be a valid CATEGORY code.
Valid CATEGORY code for use with POSITION.TRANSFER or SECURITY.TRANSFER transactions.

This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction of within T24 is allocated a CATEGORY code which enables reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operations.
4 or 5 Numeric characters. a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. (Mandatory Input)
Must be in the range 50000 to 59999.
Must exist as a valid CATEGORY code.
Specifies the COMPANY to which the user must be signed on in order to use the applications.

9 Alphanumeric characters 'CCGGGLLLL' where: CC is 2 alpha characters COUNTRY Code GGG is 3 numeric characters COMPANY Group LLLL is 4 numeric local code. or 2-3 type MNE (uppercase alphanumeric or '.') company mnemonic characters.
Must exist as a valid COMPANY code.
This parameter controls whether POSITION.TRANSFER should allow negative values to be entered in the NO.NOMINAL field or not.
This field controls whether negative fund flow should be created or not.
Input field
Accepts a either 'YES', 'NO' or Null Values.
Specifies the profit and loss CATEGORY code for the "CU.COMMISSION" amount entered in the SECURITY.TRANSFER application.

This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction within T24 is allocated a CATEGORY code which enables reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the banks operations.
5 Numeric characters. (Mandatory Input if "CU.COMMISSION" entered else Optional)
Must be in the range of 50000 to 59999
Must be a valid CATEGORY code.
A valid customer from CUSTOMER.SECURITY with any one of the following customer types BROKER, COUNTERPARY or CLIENT will be accepted in this field.
When a BIC code is given in BROKER.ADDR.BIC and the field COUNTERPARTY is null in SC.BULK.TRANSFER then value in this field will be defaulted to COUNTERPARTY.
1-10 numeric character Customer Id.
Must be a valid Customer for whom the CUSTOMER.SECURITY field CUSTOMER.TYPE equals either : a) B - Broker b) CO - Counterparty c) CL - Client
Multi valued field associated with OFS.VERSION field. Valid OFS.SOURCE record id is allowed to be input.
The OFS.SOURCE will be used with the associated OFS.VERSION for inputting and authorising applications used in SC.BULK.TRANSFER.
If a OFS.SOURCE is given then OFS.VERSION in its corresponding multi value is mandatory.
Multi valued field associated with OFS.SOURCE field. Valid VERSION record id is allowed to be input.
The OFS.VERSION will be used with the associated OFS.SOURCE for inputting and authorising applications used in SC.BULK.TRANSFER.
If a OFS.VERSION is given then OFS.SOURCE in its corresponding multi value is mandatory.
Allowed Value is YES.
If the field is set, then the CU.TAX entry will be raised in security currency instead of Local currency in SECURITY.TRANSFER.
Allowed Value is YES

If this field is set, the CU.ACC.EX.RATE in SECURITY.TRANSFER will be defaulted with MID.REVAL.RATE between security currency and account currency instead of BUY/SELL rate between security currency and account currency.
The transaction type given here will be used in FUNDS.TRANSFER records generated via SC.BULK.TRANSFER.
Must be a valid record in FT.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION
This field should accept a valid PL category (50000 to 69999).
If CHARGES is given in SC.BULK.TRANSFER, then the PL category given in this field will be defaulted in CHARGE.ACCOUNT
Must be a valid PL category (50000 to 69999).
The value in this field will be defaulted in FUND.TRANS.STATUS of SC.BULK.TRANSFER.
The field specifies the record status to which the FUNDS.TRANSFER record will be moved on authorising the SC.BULK.TRANSFER record.
If left blank then the FUNDS.TRANSFER record will be left in hold status.
However reversal of SC.BULK.TRANSFER is independent of this field.
This field will accept the values "NAU" and "AUTH".
The value in this field will be defaulted in SEC.TRANS.STATUS of SC.BULK.TRANSFER.
The field specifies the record status to which the SECURITY.TRANSFER record will be moved on authorising the SC.BULK.TRANSFER record.
If left blank then the SECURITY.TRANSFER record will be authorised.
However reversal of SC.BULK.TRANSFER is independent of this field.
This field will accept the values "NAU" and "HOLD".
The credit transaction code for the stamp tax posted
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory input).
Must exist as a valid Transaction Code.
The debit transaction code for the stamp tax posted
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory input).
Must exist as a valid Transaction Code.
Default category for stamp tax posting from Security Transfer
Mandatory input.
Must exist on the CATEGORY file.
Input must be numeric and 4 or 5 charaters long.
